text: A psalm of thanksgiving.\f + \fr Ps 100 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
Shout in triumph to Yahweh, all the earth.
come into his presence with exultation.
Know that Yahweh, he \add is\add* God;
he made us and we are his.\f + \fr 100:3 \ft According to the reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ); the \fqa Kethib \ft reads “and not we \fq ourselves \ft ” \f*
\add We are\add* his people and the sheep of his pasture.
Give thanks to him; bless his name.
For Yahweh \add is\add* good; his loyal love is forever,
and his faithfulness \add is\add* ⸤from generation to generation⸥.\f + \fr 100:5 \ft Literally “unto a generation and a generation” \f*
